main event: A bright, flashing object was observed over Mather AFB in California on July 2, 1960.
interesting points: The object appeared circular and was approximately 1.5 times the size of a full moon.
The object made several abrupt moves and changes in direction, and was viewed by several military and civilian witnesses.
The object appeared silver and metallic in color and seemed to emit a greenish glow.
The object was described as having a flashing, petal-shaped appearance with very bright rays of light.
The object moved at a very high rate of speed and disappeared over the horizon in a short time.
result: Possibly an aircraft or astronomical phenomenon
photographs: No photographs included in the report
